subject_prompt_600:
Microsoft Silverlight is a library that supports writing and reading software using the same principles of a native application. The Silverlight toolkit is written entirely in Java and provides a set of high-level APIs and a set of low-level APIs for creating native applications that run well on Mac, iPhone, iPad, PC, and other platforms. The current version is 2.0.4.

Programming guidelines and examples can be found at https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/silverlight/guide.

Submit your essay under the following conditions:

Make sure you have a Word or PDF file ready for submission (see below).

All essays must include the following information:

- title of essay

- 1,000 words; maximum 50,000 words

- no more than 400 characters including spaces and hyphens

- use the default font size for line breaks

- no more than 10 graphics elements (no figures, tables, charts or images)

Each essay should be submitted via email to silverlightexamples@microsoft.com with the subject line: "Silverlight Examples."

Please use the MSWord or PDF program you would like to submit your essay to.

Once your essay has been reviewed, you will receive instructions from us regarding our next step in the judging process. We will contact you if we believe your essay qualifies for inclusion in an upcoming column.
coupled_prompt_600: Windows Essentials is developed under license from Microsoft.
